name: Fafda
history: Fafda is a traditional Gujarati snack, popular especially during festivals. It is a crispy and savory snack made from gram flour.
description: Fafda is a crunchy, fried strip of gram flour dough, flavored with carom seeds, turmeric, and asafoetida. It is often enjoyed with chutney or jalebi, particularly during the festival of Dussehra.

instructions.title: Prepare the Dough
instructions.description: In a bowl, mix gram flour, oil, carom seeds, turmeric powder, asafoetida, salt, and baking soda. Add water gradually and knead into a stiff dough. Let it rest for 20-30 minutes.

instructions.title: Shape the Fafda
instructions.description: Divide the dough into small portions. Roll each portion into a thin strip on a rolling board using your palms.

instructions.title: Fry the Fafda
instructions.description: Heat oil in a frying pan. Deep fry the fafda strips over medium heat until crisp and golden brown.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the fafda hot with chutney or jalebi.

tips: The dough should be stiff to get the perfect texture of fafda.
Do not overcrowd the frying pan while frying fafda.
variations: Add crushed black pepper or sesame seeds to the dough for added flavor.
Experiment with different types of chutneys for serving.

storage.shelfLife: Fafda is best enjoyed fresh but can be stored in an airtight container for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store at room temperature in an airtight container.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or oven until crispy.
presentationTips: Garnish with sliced onions and sev for serving.
Arrange neatly on a platter alongside a bowl of chutney.
